description:
Add --verdict flag to the update command

Usage: tk update <id> --verdict approved|rejected

Behavior:
- Set the verdict field AND trigger verdict processing
- This is a lower-level alternative to tk approve/tk reject
- Triggers the same state machine logic

Implementation:
- Add -verdict and --verdict flags to update FlagSet
- Validate value is approved or rejected
- After setting, call verdict processing function
- Processing may close tick or clear awaiting

Note: Unlike approve/reject commands, this doesn't automatically validate that awaiting is set. The verdict processing will handle the edge case (no-op if not awaiting).

Typically users should use tk approve/tk reject which are more ergonomic and add validation.
